isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - HEATER AND AIR CONDITIONER - TROUBLESHOOTING - Heater-Bunk W/PRO SLEEPER W/Standard Temperature Control

svcproc.title: Heater-Bunk W/PRO SLEEPER W/Standard Temperature Control

table.title: Heater-Bunk With PRO SLEEPER With Standard Temperature Control

entry.para: Remove fuse F10-A and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F10-A, and measure voltage from circuit 14AU to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14AU or 14AK from B2 battery stud, then repair.
Remove aux bunk blower relay (147), and measure voltage from circuit 75W to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75W, then repair.
At aux bunk blower relay socket (147), measure voltage from circuit 75W to 12-GE.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 12-GE or 11-GBE, then repair.
Move ignition switch to the (ignition) position and at aux bunk blower relay socket (147), measure voltage from circuit 12E to 12-GE.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12E, then repair.
With 12 volts applied to terminals 85 and 86 of aux bunk blower relay (147), measure resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Replace defective aux bunk blower relay at (147).
Re-install aux bunk blower relay. Remove high speed blower relay (584), and measure voltage from circuit 75AA to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75AA or 75X, then repair.
At high speed blower relay socket (584), measure voltage from circuit 75AA to 75-GR.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-GR, 11-GBC, 11-GBD, or 11-GBE, then repair.
Disconnect connector (593). At bunk heater blower switch measure resistance from terminal B to L with switch in the low speed setting.
Bunk blower switch B to L.
At bunk heater blower switch measure resistance from terminal B to M with switch in the medium speed setting.
Bunk blower switch B to M.
At bunk heater blower switch measure resistance from terminal B to H with switch in the high speed setting.
Bunk blower switch B to H.
With ignition switch ON, at (593) measure voltage from circuit 75AG to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75AG, then repair.

Re-install connector (593), move ignition switch to the (ignition) position and bunk heater blower switch to high position. At high speed blower relay socket (584), measure voltage from circuit 75AF to 75-GR.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75AF, then repair.
With 12 volts applied to terminals 85 and 86 of high speed blower relay (584), measure resistance from terminal 30 to 87.
Replace defective high speed blower relay at (584).
Move ignition switch to the (ignition) position and bunk heater blower switch to high position. At high speed blower relay socket (584), measure voltage from circuit 75AF to 75-GR.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75AF, then repair.
Turn ignition OFF, re-install high speed blower relay at (584), and disconnect connector (586) from sleeper blower resistor network.
Move ignition switch to , and bunk heater blower switch to high. At (586) measure voltage from circuit 75AB to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75AB, then repair.
With ignition switch ON, move bunk heater blower switch to medium. At (586) measure voltage from circuit 75AC to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75AC, then repair.
With ignition switch ON, move bunk heater blower switch to low. At (586) measure voltage from circuit 75AD to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75AD, then repair.
At sleeper blower resistor network and thermo fuse assembly, measure resistance from terminals 1 to 3, 1 to 4, and 1 to 2 to verify that there is no open circuit condition.
Replace defective resistor and thermo fuse assembly.
Reconnect connector (586), and disconnect circuit 75-GAE from sleeper blower motor.
With ignition switch in the position, and the bunk heater blower switch in the high position, measure voltage at sleeper blower motor terminal to gnd.
Sleeper blower motor, terminal to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit to motor, then repair.

With ignition switch in the position, bunk heater blower switch in the high position, and circuit 75-GAE disconnected from motor, measure voltage from circuit 75-GAE to circuit still connected to sleeper blower motor terminal.
Sleeper blower motor, 75- GAE to connected circuit.
Locate open in circuit 75-GAE or 11-GAG, then repair.
Reconnect circuit 75-GAE to sleeper motor. With ignition ON and bunk heater blower switch ON, does the sleeper blower motor run?
Heater blower motor, switch, relays, and circuits check good. Continue for troubleshooting of blower damper and temperature control.
Disconnect connector (591). Turn ignition switch ON and measure voltage from circuit 75AH to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75AH, then repair.
At connector (591) with ignition switch ON, measure voltage from circuit 75AH to 75-GS.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-GS, or 11-GAF to gnd circuits, then repair.
Measure resistance from terminal 1 to 2 of winter/summer switch; flip position if necessary to achieve a reading of <1 ohm.
With switch in same position needed for resistance from terminal 1 to 2 of <1 ohm, measure resistance from terminal 4 to 5.
Flip switch to other position, and measure resistance from terminal 2 to 3.
With switch in same position, measure resistance from terminal 5 to 6.
Disconnect connector (586) and measure resistance from circuit 75-GK to gnd.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75-GK, then repair.
Move ignition switch to the position, and measure voltage at connector (586) circuit 75AP to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 75AP, then repair.
Disconnect connector (592), and at temperature control, measure resistance across terminals 75AM and 75AN. Note the resistance.

Measure resistance from wiper terminal to both outer terminals 75AM and 75AN of temperature control. Take each measurement with the control rotated to place the wiper at that terminal. Is reading approximately 39,000 ohms?
Make sure ignition switch is OFF. At connector (586) install a test jumper from circuit 75AL to 75-GK. At connector (592) measure resistance from circuit 75AL to gnd.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 75AL, then repair.
Reconnect connector (592) and at connector (591) measure resistance across circuits 75AM and 75AN. Is the resistance less than 1 ohm greater than resistance measured in step 34?
Locate short, open, or poor connection in circuit 75AN, then repair.
Reconnect connectors (586) and (591). Move ignition switch to position, and note if blower damper moves when temperature control is adjusted. Does damper move?
Temperature control circuits and components check good.
